title: How to Make Almond Toffee

steps.headline: Bake the almonds.
steps.description: Arrange the almonds single layer on a baking pan and place in a 350ºF/180ºC oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Shake the pan occasionally and turn the almonds so both sides become golden brown.

steps.headline: Combine the sugar, butter, corn syrup, salt, and 3/4 cup water in a large mixing bowl.
Remove the pan from the heat.
steps.description: Add the vanilla and half of the baked almonds. The mixture may bubble up when you add the vanilla and almonds, so be prepared.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture immediately into a 10x15 inch (25cm x 38cm) baking pans with 1” (2.5cm) sides.
steps.description: Allow to cool at room temperature. Depending upon the temperature inside your home, cooling times may take up to 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour the warm chocolate over the cooled toffee.
steps.description: Be sure to act quickly before the chocolate cools and re-sets. Use a knife or spatula to spread the chocolate evenly over the top of the toffee.

steps.headline: Allow the chocolate and toffee to set.
steps.description: Cool for up to one hour at room temperature or inside the refrigerator for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Twist the pan to loosen the toffee from the sides.

text:
Creating the Toffee Bake the almonds. Arrange the almonds single layer on a baking pan and place in a 350ºF/180ºC oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Shake the pan occasionally and turn the almonds so both sides become golden brown. Combine the sugar, butter, corn syrup, salt, and 3/4 cup water in a large mixing bowl. The butter can still be cold––simply chop it into small pieces and mix well with the other ingredients. Place the sugar, butter, corn syrup, salt, and water in a large pot and simmer on medium to low heat, stirring occasionally. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Make-Almond-Toffee-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Almond-Toffee-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Make-Almond-Toffee-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Almond-Toffee-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

Pour the mixture immediately into a 10x15 inch (25cm x 38cm) baking pans with 1” (2.5cm) sides. Allow to cool at room temperature. Depending upon the temperature inside your home, cooling times may take up to 30 minutes. Combining the Toffee and Chocolate Pour the warm chocolate over the cooled toffee. Be sure to act quickly before the chocolate cools and re-sets. Use a knife or spatula to spread the chocolate evenly over the top of the toffee. Allow the chocolate and toffee to set. Cool for up to one hour at room temperature or inside the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Twist the pan to loosen the toffee from the sides. Chop up into chunks. Finished.
